III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 7/16/25, two youth engaged in a physical altercation. Two staff
members attempted to intervene. The youth stopped fighting, but
then one youth took a fighting stance, and the physical altercation
continued. The staff did not intervene this time. They did not
attempt to restrain either youth. Eventually, one youth ran around
the table and ran out of the door. Both youths had a swollen eye
from the incident.
Investigation Interviews:
MDHHS Worker 2 was interviewed via phone on July 30, 2025.
MDHHS Worker 2 confirmed the allegations originated from an
interview with Youth D, who is associated with state licensing
investigation 2025SIC0000861. The only additional information
provided was Youth D reported Supervisor told Staff 1 there was
nothing they could do as staff to stop Youth A and Youth B, and
just to let them go at it.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth A reported
she felt safe at the facility, but did get into a fight with Youth B the
other day at the facility. She reported Supervisor, Staff 2, and
Youth B were on the unit during the time the incident occurred.
Youth A reported she had gotten mad at Youth B because Youth
D told her Youth B does not like her, and Youth A thought she was
friends with Youth B. She reported she told Youth B she did not
appreciate Youth B talking about her. Youth A reported Youth B
laughed at her, and Youth A then took off her shoes to fight Youth
B. She reported Youth B had hit Youth A in the eye with her fist.
Youth A reported she then hit Youth B back. Youth A reported
Staff 2 tried to break up the fight by telling them to stop and noted
the fight lasted only a few minutes. She reported she had a
swollen eye as a result of Youth B hitting her, and she was seen
the next day by nursing. Youth A reported she did not think she
2

needed to be seen before or taken to the hospital. She reported
Staff 2 was just standing there in the milieu after trying to get
between them while they were fighting. Youth A did not know what
Supervisor was doing during the fight. She confirmed Staff 1 and
Staff 3 were off the unit during the fight. Youth A denied ever
hearing Supervisor make any comment about just letting the youth
fight it out.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth B reported
she got into a fight with Youth A on July 16, 2025. She reported
she hit Youth A in the eye first, and then Youth A poked her in the
eye. Youth B reported Supervisor, Staff 2, and Youth C were
present during the fight. She reported Staff 1 was at the hospital
with Youth E during the time of the fight. Youth B reported Youth
D was starting drama in the unit and told Youth A that Youth B
was talking negatively about her. She reported Youth A then
threatened to fight her, so she hit Youth A first. Youth B reported
Supervisor tried to verbally de-escalate the situation and
attempted to call for additional support. She reported Staff 2
recently got into trouble for assaulting Youth E, so she did not
intervene in the fight. Youth B reported the fight lasted about 2-3
minutes. She reported Supervisor did the best she could, given
the circumstances. Youth B denied hearing any staff say anything
regarding letting me go or letting them fight.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
30, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Supervisor
reported on July 16, 2025, she had originally left for the day but
then came back to the facility because she was contacted about
the concern of Staff 2 physically assaulting Youth E. She reported
she was in the process of telling Staff 2 she needed to leave the
facility due to the allegations, and Supervisor was going to stay to
maintain the ratio of the youth. This incident is being investigated
under 2025SIC0000861. Supervisor reported when she arrived
back at the unit, Staff 1 was taking Youth E to the hospital to be
checked out, and Staff 3 was completing documentation about the
incident with Youth E and Staff 2. She reported Youth A was
triggered by that previous incident and was stating on the unit she
wanted to fight. Supervisor reported Youth A called Youth B and
Youth C, “fake ass bitches.” Youth A and Youth B began to
physically fight one another. She reported Staff 2 walked in to try
to help the situation, but Supervisor told her to stop. Supervisor
explained she was trying to explain to Staff 2 that she could not
help, given her recent situation, without saying specifically in front
of the youth why Staff 2 could not step in. It should be noted that
3

the physical assault that happened to Youth E from Staff 2
occurred while Staff 2 was attempting to restrain Youth E. Staff 2
backed off from the situation, and Supervisor reported she
attempted to verbally de-escalate the youth to stop. She reported
she tried to position herself to separate them. Supervisor stated
she told Youth B to stop, and she hit Youth A, and then Youth A
hit Youth B. The fight lasted 2-3 minutes, and they both walked
away. Supervisor reported she attempted to call for assistance but
was unable to get assistance as there were other incidents going
on at other units, and the incident lasted a short period of time.
She reported the incident lasted about ten minutes. Supervisor
reported it is also not safe to restrain Youth A alone due to her
height and size. She reported they typically call for more people to
assist if they need to restrain her. Supervisor reported she felt it
was best to try to use her physical stance to separate them and
use verbal de-escalation. She reported nursing saw Youth A and
Youth B the next day. Both the youth were given ice packs to help
with the swelling on their feet.
Youth C was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 30,
2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 1. Youth C
confirmed she witnessed the fight between Youth A and Youth B
on July 16, 2025. She reported the fight took place after the
incident that is being investigated under 2025SIC0000861. Youth
C reported Youth A started to call her and Youth B “fake ass
bitches” and Youth B began to argue with Youth A. She reported
both Youth A and Youth B removed their shoes and began
swinging their arms at each other. Youth C reported she saw
Youth B against the wall, and Youth A poked her in the eye. She
reported Youth B hit Youth A in the face. Youth C reported Staff 2
was trying to get the youth to separate and Youth B to go into the
hallway. She reported Supervisor was telling Youth A and Youth B
to stop and told Staff 2 to step away from the fight. Youth C
reported Staff 2 couldn’t be involved in the fight because there
were reports from the incident earlier that Staff 2 physically injured
Youth E, this is being investigated under 2025SIC0000861. She
reported Youth A cannot be restrained by one staff member due to
her strength. Youth C reported staff tried to verbally de-escalate
the situation. She confirmed Staff 1 and Staff 3 were not in the unit
when the fight occurred.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on August
5, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 1
reported she was working on July 16, 2025. She reported she had
to take Youth E to the hospital that evening due to an altercation
she got into with Staff 2. Staff 1 confirmed she did not witness the
4

fight between Youth A and Youth B as she was at the hospital with
Youth E. She reported when she returned to the facility, she was
told about the altercation between Youth A and Youth B by
Supervisor.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on August 5, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker 2. Staff 2 reported on July
16, 2025, that she was involved in an incident with Youth E. She
reported that after the incident occurred, Youth B and Youth C
returned to the unit. Staff 2 reported Youth A was “side-eying”
them when they walked back on. She reported at that point, she
was the only staff member on the unit as Supervisor was walking
around. Staff 2 reported Youth D was telling Youth A to calm down
and relax. She reported Youth A started calling Youth B and Youth
C names, and things started to escalate. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor walked fully into the milieu trying to verbally de-
escalate Youth A and was trying to calm her down. Staff 2
reported she attempted to verbally encourage Youth B to come off
the unit and away from Youth A, but Youth B continued to verbally
argue with Youth A. She reported Youth A “ran up” on Youth B,
and they started to physically fight. Staff 2 reported due to the
previous incident with Youth E that day she was not allowed to
restrain per Supervisor’s direction. She reported she only
attempted to verbally de-escalate the situation. Staff 2 reported
Supervisor called for support and was talking to Youth A and
Youth B in an attempt to get them to de-escalate. She reported
Supervisor tried to position herself between the two youth to stop
the fight. Staff 2 confirmed Supervisor would not be able to
restrain the youth alone. She denied Supervisor ever stating to
just let the youth fight it out. Staff 2 reported Supervisor was doing
the best she could do given the situation. She reported the
physical fight only lasted a couple of minutes, and support arrived
after the fight was done.
Video Recording
Video record of July 16, 2025 during the time of 8:12pm to
8:15pm was reviewed by this consultant and MDHHS Worker
2 on August 6, 2025. This video recording was reviewed at
the facility in collaboration with Administrator. It should be
noted there is no sound to the video. The video recording took
place in the milieu area. At the start of the video recording, Youth
B and Youth C were standing at one of the ends of the room and
Youth A, Youth D, and Staff 2 were standing at the other end.
Supervisor was walking around the unit securing the area by
closing closet doors and making sure all items were put away.
Around 8:13pm, Youth B walked towards Youth A and Supervisor
5

stands in between the youth. Staff 2 was among them as well
trying to walk away with Youth B from the situation. Youth B
continued to turn back around and then headed back towards
Youth A. Supervisor attempted to use her body to block them from
each other, but Youth A and Youth B engaged in a physical fight.
Youth A and Youth B were swinging at one another with their fists.
Supervisor appeared to have opened the office door at one point,
which was noted in interviews she was attempting to get additional
support. At 8:14pm Youth A and Youth B are disengaged from the
fight. The total physical fight was less than 120 seconds. Youth C
and Youth D remained at the other end of the milieu when the
fight occurred. The video ended with Staff 2 walking Youth C,
Youth D, and Youth B off the milieu and Supervisor staying in the
milieu with Youth A. An additional staff member did arrive to the
unit a few seconds after the youth were separated.
Documents Reviewed:
- Email from MDHHS Worker 2 dated July 30, 2025- This
email noted the interview that occurred with MDHHS
Worker 2 and Youth D on July 29, 2025. This interview took
place to coincide with the licensing investigation
2025SIC0000861. Youth D reported about twenty minutes
after Staff 2 had physically assaulted Youth E another
incident broke out. She reported Youth B and Youth C
returned to the unit and Youth A was upset about the
situation involving Youth E. Youth D stated Youth A thought
Youth B and Youth C were laughing at her. Youth A then
asked the other youth what they were laughing at. Youth A
and Youth B walked up on each other and physically
started to fight. Youth D reported staff tried to intervene, but
they could not stop them. MDHHS Worker 2 asked Youth D
who the staff were that were involved, and she stated it was
Supervisor and Staff 1. She stated Youth A and Youth B
started to fight again and staff just stood there. Youth D
was asked if staff called for additional support and she
stated that staff did not call for support.
- Facility incident report dated July 16, 2025 completed
by Supervisor- Incident reported noted Youth A made
comments to Youth B stating, “You are so fake.” Youth B
then responded with “I know you aren’t talking about me.”
Youth A then instigated a fight with Youth B by punching
her. Youth B fought back and hit Youth A. This all occurred
6

for about a few moments. Supervisor utilized verbal de-
escalation to be able to separate the youth.
- Facility Nursing Note for Youth A dated July 17, 2025-
Youth A was seen in person by nursing due to being
punched in the eye by Youth B. During the physical exam,
nursing noted there was no significant swelling of orbital
socket but noted some minor bruising below Youth A’s left
eye. Nursing did a follow up check later that day which
there were no further noted concerns of vision loss or
redness.
- Facility Nursing Note for Youth B dated July 17, 2025-
Youth B was seen in person by nursing due to concerns of
Youth A poking her in the eye. Both eyes were assessed
and there was no redness or swelling around the orbits.
Youth B denied any pain, discomfort or vision changes at
the time of the assessment.
- Facility’s Client Safety Policy dated April 18, 2018- This
policy notes that staff are responsible to assure that clients
are kept safe and secure while in care.
- Facility’s Behavior Management Procedures-
Prohibited Techniques dated June 2, 2025- This policy
notes staff are not allowed to let “clients fight it out.”
- Facility’s Crisis Management Procedure dated July 25,
2023- Staff should only use physical restraint in emergency
situations to ensure a youth’s physical safety or safety of
others, an only when all less restrictive interventions are
determined to be ineffective. Physical restraint should only
be performed in a manner that is safe, appropriate and
proportionate to severity of the minor child’s behavior,
chronological and developmental age, size, gender,
physical condition, medical condition, psychiatric condition,
and personal history, including any history of physical or
sexual abuse.
- Human Resource File for Supervisor- There was one
disciplinary action noted within Supervisor’s HR file from
01/31/2023. This was due to Supervisor making
inappropriate comments and did not address the need to
provide safety for a youth via text message to a staff
member. Supervisor completed this group plan on
05/4/2023. Supervisor is up to date on all required trainings
7

and had her most recent behavior management/ AGEIS
training on 11/14/2024.
- Termination Letter for Staff 2 dated July 31, 2025- Staff
2 was provided a termination letter of employment on July
31, 2025, due to an incident that took place on July 16,
2025. It was noted that video footage was reviewed by
multiple leadership staff. During video footage review, Staff
2 was seen completing an improper physical management
on a youth, causing the client to fall to the ground and
failing to disengage the physical management.
Analysis The facility was found in compliance as Supervisor and Staff 2
intervened appropriately within the situation as noted within the
interviews and review of the video. There was a prior incident that
occurred with Staff 2 and another youth which made it, so Staff 2
was not allowed to restrain within this situation. Supervisor knew
that it would not be safe to restrain the youth on her own, so she
made sure the area was cleared, asked for additional support to
be contacted, and used verbal de-escalation to calm down the
youth. The incident lasted about three minutes and staff were
seen engaging in trying to calm the situation down within the
video. It should be noted that in the original allegations, there was
concerns of Staff 1 and Supervisor not intervening the fight. It was
found that Staff 1 was not present as she was at the hospital with
Youth E and it was actually Staff 2 that was present during the
fight.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
8

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
